events.title: Quadrantid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: The Quadrantids meteor shower peaks around January 3–4. This is one of the year's earliest major showers with up to 120 meteors per hour under ideal conditions. Best viewed after midnight.

events.title: Lyrid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: Lyrids are active around April 22, with rates of 10–20 meteors per hour under good conditions. Associated with Comet C/1861 G1 Thatcher.

events.title: Eta Aquariid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: The Eta Aquariids, associated with Halley's Comet, peak around May 5–6. Expect 40-60 meteors per hour. Best viewed in pre-dawn hours.

events.title: Southern Delta Aquariid Meteor Shower
events.description: Delta Aquariids are active from late July to early August. One of the more southern-hemisphere-friendly showers with 20-25 meteors per hour.

events.title: Perseid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: The Perseids peak around August 12–13. Under ideal conditions, you could see 60–100+ meteors per hour. One of the most popular annual showers!

events.title: Draconid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: The Draconids peak around October 8. Usually modest rates but can occasionally produce outbursts. Best viewed in early evening unlike most showers.

events.title: Orionid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: Orionids peak around October 21–22. These are debris from Halley's Comet and often produce fast meteors at 66 km/s. Expect 20-25 meteors per hour.

events.title: Southern Taurid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: Southern Taurids peak around November 5. Known for slow, bright fireballs. Low rates but spectacular individual meteors.

events.title: Northern Taurid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: Northern Taurids peak around November 12. Like their southern counterpart, known for slow-moving fireballs. Low rates but impressive brightness.

events.title: Leonid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: Leonids peak around November 17–18. Known for bright fireballs and occasional meteor storms (every 33 years). Expect 10-15 meteors per hour.

events.title: Geminid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: The Geminids are one of the richest annual showers, peaking December 13–14. Up to 150 meteors per hour under ideal conditions. Multicolored meteors!

events.title: Ursid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: The Ursids peak around December 21–22. A modest shower with 5-10 meteors per hour, but has been known to produce surprise outbursts.

events.title: Quadrantid Meteor Shower Peak
events.description: The Quadrantids meteor shower peaks around January 3–4, 2027. This is one of the year's earliest major showers with up to 120 meteors per hour.
